name: Meaningless Denial
description:
Have you ever said "no" without anythink or any meaning of it? 

Do you say "no" just because you want to say something without rejecting your partner's words?

"No" has become a catchphrase that many of us say, whether it's starting a sentence just to continue the conversation. Or even just to join the conversation, we say "no", but the following sentences follow the same lines as the interlocutor.

"no..."
"no..."
"no"

How many times do we say "no" while we are talking to other people without meaning to it?

Every time someone says this to me, there is always a question that pops up in my mind, "What exactly are you denying?"

Since you didn't deny what I said...or that...

In fact... are you saying "no" just to deny "me" who you are talking to?
